channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024070773
item.description:
Report E-2024070773

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-03T00:38:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: HERMITAGE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Pitt Ohio
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon arrival at the destination terminal, the drum was discovered to be leaking on the linehaul trailer. Investigation revealed that the drum may have been punctured by a protruding nail or screw in the trailer roll door. The puncture was very small and at the top of the drum so only a small amount of material was released. When stationary, the drum was not leaking. The drum was set aside awaiting disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024072393
item.description:
Report X-2024072393

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Preload thought the package was damaged and 99'd it on the 25th. I did not see it until the 26th and upon inspection I determined it wasn't damaged beyond the outer box having been splashed by something. The actual item inside was perfectly fine, I tested it and even had it sit out for a few hours to see if it leaked. Once I determined it wasn't damaged, I reboxed it and wrapped it in bubble wrap and spill pads, then set it out to be put on the vans by Preload. When I came in today I found it back at the hazmat cage with a puncture in the bottom of the bottle.

item.title: Report X-2024072457
item.description:
Report X-2024072457

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-C. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PACKAGE, HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 1 MINUTE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY, 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROXIMATELY 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND SECONDARY CONTAINMENT CONSISTED OF A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.description:
Report X-2024072474

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A CALL WAS MADE TO THE PSC STATING THERE WAS A HAZMAT IN THE TOP BIN THAT WAS LEAKED ON OR LEAKING. RESPONDER DONNED PPE BRINGING THE DECISION TREE. WHEN SHE SAW THE PACKAGE, SHE KNEW IT WAS LEAKING. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, SHE BEGAN THE PROCESS TO CONTAIN THE BOX IN A SPILL TUB AND ALL THE SUBSEQUENT AFFECTED PACKAGES. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE ACTION STEPS AND REMOVED ALL AFFECTED ITEMS AND DECONTAMINATED THE BINS. THE PACKAGES WERE TAKEN TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING AND FINAL DISPOSITION ACCORDING TO PROCEDURE.

item.title: Report X-2024072422
item.description:
Report X-2024072422

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: MC ALLEN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PM CLERK FOUND LEAKING STEEL DRUM AMONG CLERICAL PACKAGES AND CALLED PM HAZMAT RESPONDER, WHO DONNED PPE, TOOK A SPILL CART AND RESPONDED TO THE INCIDENT. STEEL DRUM WAS LEAKING VERY SLOWLY (DROP BY DROP), SO THE SPILL WAS MINIMAL. STEEL DRUM WAS TAKEN TO DMP, AND ONCE THE LEAK WAS DETERMINED TO BE COMING FROM THE BOTTOM SEAL OF THE DRUM AND THAT IT THEREFORE COULDN'T BE KEPT FROM LEAKING FURTHER, THE ENTIRE CONTENTS WERE SOLIDIFIED WITH ZEP SORBENT AND GREEN-BAGGED.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/21/2024 at approximately 1733, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 926763 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a printing ink spill. The shipment consisted of 4 fiberboard boxes, each containing 4-1 gallon plastic jugs. The shipment under the tracking number ending in -9348, was reportedly mishandled, resulting in spillage. The ink from the spill soaked into the labels, destroying all of the pertinent package information. The damaged pacakge was placed in a salvage drum and the entire shipment is being held for the FAA.

The shipment consisted of 8 metal cans, each individually overpacked in a fiberboard box, and then all were overpacked onto a pallet. One the packages was reportedly damaged due to mishandling, resulting in spillage. The damaged package was placed in a salvage drum and the entire shipment is being held, awating an amended shipper's declaration to be returned to the shipper.

DMN WAS TAKEN TO DMN PROCESSING AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: On July 18, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jug of corrosive liquid was punctured and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized absorbents and cleaners to remediate the site. All waste was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for future disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2024072251

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE CONTENTS WERE INSPECTED DUE TO A SIMILAR GROUND PACKAGE CAME THROUGH AT THE SAME TIME AND WAS FOUND WITH UNDECLARED CONTENTS. UPON INSPECTION OF THIS AIR PACKAGE, WE FOUND 20 X 12 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE QUICK CURE MULTI-PURPOSE FOAM SEALANT INSIDE THE BOX. THERE IS A POUCH AFFIXED TO THE OUTER BOX WITH A PACKING SLIP THAT INDICATES LTD QTY HAZMAT, CLASS 2.2, UN1956. THOSE INDICATORS WERE NOT VISIBLE AT THE TIME OF INSPECTION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS AFFIXED TO THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/10/2024 at approximately 0730, Dangerous Good Administration received notification of a dangerous goods spill at the station location in Hampton from Employee 4346935. The shipment consisted of 4 fiberboard boxes, each containing one fire extinguisher. One of the package which shipped under the tracking number ending in -1105, appeared to have been mishandled and showed evidence of spillage. Further inspection revealed the extiguisher inside of the mishandled package had accidentally discharged inside of the outer package. The spilled package was placed in a salvage drum and set for disposal and the remaining pieces of the shipment are being held, pending the receipt of an amended shipper's declaration from the shipper.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN3469, Klean Strip Premium Stripper release from (7) 1-gallon metal cans. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the boxes the cans were in and estimated that 0.5-gallons of material was released due to being crushed because of improper loading. The release impacted the cardboard packaging and pallet on the trailer. The damaged cans were placed into a55-gallon poly drum along with damaged and impacted cardboard. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN SAFE AND TIMELY MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 10 LITERS LEAKED OUT DUE TO ALL 4 CAPS BEING LOOSE AND ALSO 2 CAPS HAD A TINY HOLES IN EACH OF THEM. AWAITING THE DISPOSITION NOW FROM PGH.

  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazmat was found at door 125 in the load end ready to go to the next load point. The outbound sort manager walked passed it and noticed a very strong odor coming from the box. QA was contacted immediately to inspect the box. I noticed a little wet spot on one of the bottom corners of the package and brought it over to the office in a lined tote for further inspection. The inner drum seamed to have a poor quality closure that caused some of the contents to spill out and make it a little noticeable to the naked eye. Once the package was fully opened, the corrugated liner seamed to be wet also to confirm that the hazmat was damaged and could have possibly been damaged while it was on the vehicle when the driver returned from the pick up but could have dried do to the Acetone & Isopropyl Alcohol ingredient that makes up the product.

item.title: Report E-2024070693
item.description:
Report E-2024070693

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T21:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: BAY SHORE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO- XIY contacted ERTS regarding leaking 1-gallon bottles of Muriatic Acid. It is apparent that the leaking bottles may have had loose fitting caps and therefore improper packaging is the cause of the release. Approximately, 2-liters of product spilled onto the concrete dock floor in a 2x2 area. A Contractor contained the release using oil dry and neutralized the product using sodium bicarbonate. One drum of waste was generated for the overpacked and neutralized muriatic acid and one empty drum that last contained the leaking product until a Contractor could dispatch was generated, as well. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HEPACO was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that four (4) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging four (4) plastic jugs. HEPACO personnel moved all the boxes from the pallet to verify only four (4) jugs were damaged, deployed absorbents, and then swept up the released material. The damaged boxes, jugs and recovered material were placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported to ERTS that 2-55 gallon poly drums of UN3214 Carusol Liquid Permanganate were found leaking on the dock due to faulty packaging from the shipper. Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the pallet and estimated that seven (7) ounces of material were released from four (4) 55-gallon poly drums. Clean Harbors personnel overpacked the leaking drums into four (4) 95-gallon poly drums and containerized the pallet and spent PPE into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for disposal.

  • Description: At approximately 22 : 11 a package containing an undelcared 6000Wh lithium ion battery, with terminals unprotected, was placed on the metal grating outside of door 102. Moments later, the package started emitting smoke and plant engineering was notified. The package caught on fire and employees evacuated the building as the fire department was called. A mechanic and his supervisor attempted to extinguish the fire but it kept reigniting. The fire department arrived, pulled the package outside, and extinguished it. At 22:58. the fire department gave the 'all cleaT to return to the building.

  • Description: When the Veolia employees arrived at Martha Jefferson hospital and opened the back of the truck, they discovered that the load had shifted during transportation. This caused a 12 gallon medical waste bin from Sentara to be crushed and the lid popped off. It is estimated that less than a pint of liquid spilled onto the floor and the surrounding containers. The spill was contained to the back of the truck. There were no injuries as a result of the spill. The spill was cleaned and the containers affected were overpacked without further incident.

item.title: Report E-2024070645
item.description:
Report E-2024070645

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 23, 2024, at 1039 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Orlando, Florida regarding the release of Eucalyptus Polybractea. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that there was 1 damaged 55-gallon DM of Eucalyptus Polybractea, which was wrapped in plastic to stop the leak. No puddling was found outside of the plastic wrapping where the drum was located. Contractors secured the drum with additional wrapping and placed it in a 95-gallon overpack to be staged onsite. No waste was generated from addressing this release during the ER response.

item.title: Report E-2024070642
item.description:
Report E-2024070642

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-20
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 20, 2024, at 1605 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Albuquerque, New Mexico regarding the release of Ecolab Aqua Balance Pool and Spa Disinfectant. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 15 gallons of Ecolab Aqua Balance Pool and Spa Disinfectant (UN1791, 8, III) from (1)15-gallon plastic drum. The release was caused by a puncture from a pallet due to a load shift and contained to a 3ft x 25ft area of the trailer floor, and a 4ft x 2ft area of asphalt beneath the trailer. Contractors placed the damaged empty drum in an overpack then cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The overpack was secured in the trailer to be forwarded on to the original consignee. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • Description: SRIX 32187 released due to and open liquid valve, and the secondary closure plug was less than tool tight. Car was discover leaking in Ogden UT. Upon investigation there was an ice block formed around the valve and the liquid valve was found open and the secondary closure plug was less than tool tight. Valve would not seal after closure and secondary plug was secured to prevent further release. Car is on hold awaiting OTMA.

  • City: RICHFIELD

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazmat was found at door 125 in the load end ready to go to the next load point. The outbound sort manager walked passed it and noticed a very strong odor coming from the box. QA was contacted immediately to inspect the box. I noticed a little wet spot on one of the bottom corners of the package and brought it over to the office in a lined tote for further inspection. The inner drum seamed to have a poor quality closure that caused some of the contents to spill out and make it a little noticeable to the naked eye. Once the package was fully opened, the corrugated liner seamed to be wet also to confirm that the hazmat was damaged and could have possibly been damaged while it was on the vehicle when the driver returned from the pick up but could have dried do to the Acetone & Isopropyl Alcohol ingredient that makes up the product.

  • Description: Driver was doing pre trip and noticed a couple drips coming from trailer at approximately 0830 ct. Drive put down some absorbent then called the company's emergency number. The team was dispatched to the location arriving around 1100ct. They began unloading the trailer and found a 55 gallon drum with a pinhole in it. The drum did not look damaged other than the pin hole. The team then put the drum into a salvage drume and the material was cleaned up with absorbent and the disposed of in the appropriate manor. The clean up was completed by 1400ct. There was approximately 1 cup released on the floor of the trailer.

Clean Harbors estimates 100 gallons released impacting an approximate 75yd by 40yd area of asphalt and concrete.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5010
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/26/2024, at 1048 hours, personnel in the CSXT Ashtabula Yard discovered TILX 113642, a residue tank car of Hydrochloric Acid, leaking from the protective housing area. The car was isolated and the shipper, INEOS, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-0626-143). EnviroServe, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the primary liquid line closure flange not properly prepared for transportation. Contractor personnel properly secured the closure and decontaminated the car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- Jeanne Kochevar (440-228-8373).

  • City: ANCHORAGE

  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ANCHORAGE, ALASKA ONE GROUND TO ALASKA PACKAGE FROM CALIFORNIA WAS INSPECTED DUE TO SECURITY HEARING A RATTLE AEROSOL SOUND COMING FROM THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED SEVEN INNER BOXES WITH FLAMMABLE GAS 2.1 PICTOGRAMS AND UN2037. EACH OF THESE SEVEN INNER BOXES CONTAIN TWELVE X 10.14 OUNCE CANS OF NEON QUINTUPLE REFINED PREMIUM BUTANE LIGHTER REFILLS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON ONE UPS FLIGHT FROM ONT TO ANC.

item.title: Report X-2024072084
item.description:
Report X-2024072084

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT APPROXIMATELY 20:45 THE SUPERVISOR FROM THE PD 11 CALLED THE DMP CAGE TO INFORM THAT THERE WAS A LEAKING HAZMAT IN DOOR 112. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER DONNING PROPER PPE ARRIVED ON SCENE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. UPON ENTERING THE TRAILER THEY DISCOVERED A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE LYING ON ITS SIDE. AFTER REFERRING TO THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THEY ACTED ACCORDINGLY. THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON OPENING THE SINGLEWALL FIBREBOARD BOX IT WAS DETERMINED THE CAUSE OF THE LEAKAGE WAS A LOOSE CAP. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN DISPOSED OF ACCORDING TO THE DMP FLOW CHART AND PROPER APPENDIX.

  • City: New Orleans

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 7 According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While intermodal container was staged at the STG Logistics yard, a leak was discovered coming from the back of container. Area was isolated and United States Environmental Services was dispatched to perform cleanup. Louisiana DEQ responded to assess. Upon opening container, one 55-gallon drum was discovered with a faulty seam. Approximately 1 gallon had released from the drum, which impacted the container floor and minimal amount to gravel surface beneath. Due to the nature of the product, the product evaporated upon contact with the air, and no cleanup was required. Absorbent pads were utilized as a precautionary measure, damaged drum was overpacked into an 85-gallon overpack, and all cleanup debris was placed within overpack drum. The overpack drum was placed back in the container, pending disposition. There was no threat or impact to state waters. There were no injuries or exposures reported.

The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents and pads. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly and 35-gallon poly drums. The waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024070061
item.description:
Report I-2024070061

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: Beaumont
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARTIN TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Loaded trailer was on our yard in Beaumont, TX when it was discovered to be Ieaking from a flange. The emergency shut off was used in hopes of stopping the leak. This attempt did not work because the product was actually coming from the flange above the external valve. Proper PPE was donned and the pressure was released from the top of the trailer. This slowed the leak down enough for our shop supervisor to don the proper PPE and check all the bolts and nuts on the flange. We found two nuts were very loose. These nuts were tightened up and the leak was completely stop. After our immediate investigation was completed, we discover that the two nuts that were lose had two lock washers that had flattened out not allowing the nuts to stay tight.
